Boston.com

Suspect in killing of Afghan civilians identified

A senior U.S. official spoke on the condition of anonymity that the soldier accused in the killings of 16 Afghan civilians is Army Staff Sgt. Robert Bales. (AP, 6:50 p.m.)

NStar announces overnight
outage for 8,000 customers

NStar will cut power to 8,000 customers at 3 a.m. for repairs. The outage will last three hours "barring any unforeseen circumstances," NStar said. (Globe, 5:43 p.m.)
  • Brian McGrory The powerful and the powerless
  • Neil Swidey What if the lights go out?
  • video Fixing Boston's streets after the outage | Pictures

Ex-Rutgers student found guilty in dorm spying case

Dharun Ravi, accused of spying on his gay roommate's love life, was convicted of a hate crime. (AP, 6:50 p.m.)
  • Discuss Share your thoughts

How to prepare for the Boston marathon

Proper nutrition is key for the 20,000 entrants signed up to run the 26.2-mile course next month. Check out how runners should fuel their bodies for race day.
  • Tips from marathoner Bill Rodgers | Is running healthy?
  • Cut race time | Marathon to offer CPR training
  • How running affects the body | Tips on proper nutrition

Mattapan massacre jury sent home

The Suffolk County jury was sent home for the weekend after failing to reach a verdict in the Mattapan case of two men charged in a quadruple murder. (Globe, 5:13 p.m.)
  • Pictures The Mattapan massacre trial and crime scene

City calls for restraint at Sunday's parade

Officials released a statement today that said police will have zero tolerance for public consumption of alcohol at the St. Patrick's Day parade. (Boston Globe, 1:53 p.m.)

Romney sidesteps statehood in open letter to Puerto Ricans

Mitt Romney said in an open letter to the people of Puerto Rico that he “will work to settle the island’s 113-year political status question,” but he once again stopped short of saying whether he favors statehood.
